title: Pull request merge from MartinPerez/nilearn:glass_brain_hemispheres to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: This does look very nice! On the images at the top (with a white background), there is a strange yellow background color.
I am positive that there is something in the background. I can see the rectangles.

> We merge the PR and start a new one to push to upper classes and add connectomics?

I would like the code duplication to be addressed before this lands in
master. Code duplication makes the repo hard to read and understand. I
don't want to degrade the quality of the repo, even with the promise that
it will improve later.

> For me solution to this problem is to add a line saying that images should be
> in MNI space. We always pressure this point to users to avoid surprising
> results.

+1

What's the status on the hemisphere plotting of connectomes in this PR?

PS: sorry, I think that I just introduced a trivial conflict with master.

Indeed, very nice!

We would need a tiny example demoing it.

Maybe you can do a new example in the plotting section that demos plot connectome and replace the image in https://circle-artifacts.com/gh/nilearn/nilearn/1495/artifacts/0/home/ubuntu/nilearn/doc/_build/html/plotting/index.html#different-plotting-functions by the image it generates (and link to that example).

I think that, for now, we could use a hard-coded set of coordinates and connectivity matrix, for instance inspired by: https://circle-artifacts.com/gh/nilearn/nilearn/1495/artifacts/0/home/ubuntu/nilearn/doc/_build/html/auto_examples/03_connectivity/plot_adhd_spheres.html#sphx-glr-auto-examples-03-connectivity-plot-adhd-spheres-py

It would enable us to demo the hemisphere plotting for connectomes.
Whoooot

![connectome](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8766915/13916520/737e06e4-ef5b-11e5-8ae5-b791339be912.png)

well connectome included and code generalized to upper classes. I also figured out that it was completely unnecessary to have the svg image for the right hemisphere, since the matplotlib x axis could be inverted.
of course added smoke test and example update for connectome
took care of all comments and tests passed except for the unrelated memory profiler one in travis.
It would be worth to modify the docs to show the new modes in http://nilearn.github.io/plotting/index.html#different-display-modes.
@GaelVaroquaux its also ready for the connectome. Look for the image above.

In the auto_examples folder, there is the 'connectivity' folder instead of '03_connectivity' although many links still point to '03_connectivity'. Should I change the folder name or is this a new standard to enforce in all links?

> Should I change the folder name or is this a new standard to enforce in all links?

No, you don't have to it will generate it automatically while you `make html` in doc folder.
LGTM.
LGTM too. Merging. Thanks a lot!

Awesome! thanks!

You mean the two first images? I see it white :S
in two screens (desktop, laptop) I see it white. No yellow background... @AlexandreAbraham what do you see?

I fixed the background issue and discovered on the way that I have some yellow daltonism, haha.

![figure_10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8766915/13402645/83d017bc-df11-11e5-9fab-4eb6c43bf6a6.png)

Addressed all comments. Added lyr, lzr and lzry and actually generalized the code to accept any order of labels in the future, which also simplified the hemispheric projector class. Added smoke test on test_img_plotting.py.

Examples here:

![figure_11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8766915/13405055/f95bfff4-df1c-11e5-947d-dd3a07e4d795.png)

circle ci pass now. The appveyor new error seems unrelated to the changes of this PR.

@AlexandreAbraham I addressed your comments. We merge the PR and start a new one to push to upper classes and add connectomics?
@chrisfilo thanks for the reference, I will check it out.

> I would like the code duplication to be addressed before this lands in master

ok I will work on the upper classes then. 

Who can give me a hand with checking the logic of the connectomics, or I leave that for later?

@AlexandreAbraham Its fine now, but there is a small problem if the user tried to pass an img not in mni space, which should not be the case anyway. Could you please give me your opinion on how to handle that?
@KamalakerDadi I created version 0.2.5 in whats_new.rst, I assume thats the next release.

@AlexandreAbraham it seems there is an unrelated error in travis.
ERROR: nilearn.tests.test_testing.test_memory_usage

> but there is a small problem if the user tried to pass an img not in mni space, which should not be the case anyway. Could you please give me your opinion on how to handle that?

For me solution to this problem is to add a line saying that images should be in MNI space. We always pressure this point to users to avoid surprising results.
Please also add a line about this new feature in `whats_new.rst`
We want to keep this example as simple as possible. I suggest that we remove that last line, which belongs more to the advanced example.

text: I also noticed that some changes would just mean one line in the parent classes. Nonetheless I put all the changes in the GlassBrainHemisphericAxes class for 2 reasons. First its not just GlassBrainAxes but also BaseAxes that would have modifications, I thought having spread changes across multiple classes for one feature might be confusing in the future and could break some other derived class (so far its assume for all the plotting framework that only xyz exist). Second I am not sure how the changes introduced would interact with the connectomics plots that also use the GlassBrainAxes class. I think putting this together and checking how this should be used with the connectomics should be a different PR. @GaelVaroquaux what do you think?

text:
@AlexandreAbraham as I understood from http://nipy.org/nibabel/coordinate_systems.html, the affine is not necessarily diagonal but is invertible and its last row is 0,0,0,1. Nibabel documentation explain that [i,j,k,1] = dot(inv(M), [x,y,z,1]) so I am trusting thats the case. Since for the glass brain we are in MNI space I am assuming I can consider space coordinates 0,0,0 to ask for the actual voxel indices corresponding to the center.

Does this answer your question?

title: (None, '', u'nilearn/plotting/displays.py')

text:
> By the way just wondering what should we do if xc == 0 (maybe that never
> happens in practice I am not sure). Should we not show the marker on both 'l'
> and 'r' plots?

Actually, that's probably a good idea. And that way we have edges going
to it in both plot (this needs to be documented in the docstrings of
add_marker and plot_connectome).

text: hemisphere glass brain without connectomics
updated example and debugging script
fixed thresholding issue when copying data array
added extensive example
background glitch fix
added arbitrary axes order functionality and simplified hemisphericprojector. Also addressed some comments on the docs and examples. added smoke test for glass brain with hemispheres
trying to address circle ci docs issue
doc change
coordinate determination fix and comments
comment fix
pep8 and comments improvement
generalized previous code
generalization tests update
updated example with blocks
added connectomics, generalized and improved code, including glass brain
small fixes examples
minor example comments. avoid data copy in displays
correction to handle smoke test
added clarification of mni space and comment on whats new doc
doc correction
minor comments corrections. saggital to sagittal and titles in plots.
coordinate x==0 included in both hemispheres now. Adressing also minor comments in the docs. Simplified example
updated example
changed reference image to example and link
added display modes to documentation
save memory on plot tests with plt.close()
